<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HOUSING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/08/americans-hit-economic-crisis-withhold-rent-checks?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Coronavirus Turns Landlords Into Landserfs
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="NYC apartment illustration" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MzUvbnljX2FwYXJ0bWVudF9pbGx1c3RyYXRpb24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nearly one-third of U.S. apartment renters <a href="https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/epg3xz/a-whole-lot-of-people-couldnt-pay-rent-this-month?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">did not pay</a> any April rent in the first week of the month, according to the National Multifamily Housing Council and a group of real estate data providers. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>For comparison’s sake...19% of tenants did not pay any rent in the first week of March and 18% didn’t in April 2019. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>This is not a case of mass “I left the check on the kitchen table.” The statistic highlights the severe pressure the coronavirus crisis has put on personal finances. Nearly 10 million Americans filed for unemployment in the last two weeks of March alone. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/nearly-a-third-of-u-s-renters-didnt-pay-april-rent-11586340000?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">few notes</a></span><span> about the data, to cover our bases: It does not count single-family homes and excludes public housing and subsidized affordable housing. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s...going to happen? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Local and state governments across the country have enacted eviction moratoriums to keep people in their homes—for example, in March NY Gov. Andrew Cuomo suspended evictions for 90 days. But this economic crisis will last longer than those moratoriums, so some officials predict a “<a href="https://ny.curbed.com/2020/4/7/21212353/new-york-coronavirus-rent-eviction-bill-covid-19?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tidal wave</a>” of evictions in a few months unless they act.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There’s been <em>some </em>action:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The $2.2 trillion rescue package from the federal government expands unemployment coverage and gives most Americans a one-time direct payment. That aid should help, though it’s not directly tied to the housing market.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>One NYC landlord became a folk hero when he </span><span><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/landlord-waives-april-rent-200-tenants-amid-coronavirus-wants-everybody-n1176736?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">waived April rent</a></span><span> for his 200 tenants. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But those stopgap measures aren’t enough on their own, especially because the real estate market has more moving parts than <em>Westworld</em>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As Bloomberg’s Brian Chappatta <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2020-03-25/coronavirus-a-rent-wipeout-could-ignite-a-mortgage-crisis?sref=1crrKBaO&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a>, if tenants can’t afford to pay rent then property owners may default on mortgage payments. “That could bring the problem squarely onto the balance sheets of large U.S. banks.”</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
2020
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/08/bernie-sanders-drops-dem-primary?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Bernie Sanders Is Once Again Dropping Out
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sen. Bernie Sanders <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/04/08/politics/bernie-sanders-drops-out/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dropped out</a> of the Democratic presidential nomination race yesterday. Pour one out, but only the 99%. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>That leaves former VP Joe Biden as the presumptive nominee. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Roll the tape: </strong>Sanders, a self-described “democratic socialist,” pitched heavy taxes on the wealthy, the middle class, and corporations to fund large government programs like making public colleges and universities free, eliminating student and medical debt, and reorienting the economy to combat climate change. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In late February, it looked like Sanders could take this thing home. But he stumbled hard in big state primaries like Florida and Michigan. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> He may be 0 for 2 in presidential primaries in the last four years, but Sanders has <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/bernie-sanders-ends-bid-for-white-house-11586359593?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">succeeded in pulling</a> the Democratic Party left. Once pie-in-the-sky, initiatives he championed like Medicare for All and the Green New Deal now have the support of many Democrats. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Sanders will still be on the ballot as state primaries continue, enabling him to rack up delegates so he can exert more influence at the party convention in August.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BANKING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/08/fed-temporarily-lifts-cap-wells-fargo-assets?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
For Wells Fargo, Trust Is Given, Not Earned
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 1.38;"><span style="text-decoration: none;">Yesterday, the Federal Reserve </span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/fed-eases-wells-fargos-asset-cap-to-lend-to-small-businesses-harmed-by-coronavirus-11586360144?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">temporarily lifted its cap</a><span style="text-decoration: none;"> on Wells Fargo’s growth, proving you can get out of any grounding by washing the dishes or committing to lend to struggling small businesses.</span><span style="text-decoration: none;"></span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 1.38;"><span style="text-decoration: none;">The Fed put a $1.95 trillion cap on Wells Fargo’s assets in 2018 as punishment for its fake account scandal. That meant Wells could only dole out </span><a href="https://www.charlotteobserver.com/news/business/banking/article241846121.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$10 billion in loans</a><span style="text-decoration: none;"> to small businesses taking advantage of the government’s $349 billion Paycheck Protection Program (PPP).</span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 1.38;"><span style="text-decoration: none;">Wells Fargo said it hit that $10 billion threshold in one weekend. As the U.S.’ </span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/08/the-fed-is-lifting-wells-fargos-asset-cap-so-it-can-help-lend-to-small-business.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">No. 3 bank by assets</a><span style="text-decoration: none;">, its participation in lending programs is as important as cold butter in your biscuit dough.</span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 1.38;"><strong style="color:#000"><span style="text-decoration: none;">So the Fed loosened up.</span></strong><span style="text-decoration: none;"><strong style="color:#000"> </strong>Now, Wells can exceed that asset cap c/o loans made through either 1) PPP or 2) the forthcoming Main Street lending program, a Fed/Treasury collab. Any money Wells Fargo makes on the loans goes to the Treasury or a small business-focused nonprofit.</span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 1.38;"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the bank gets a break “<a href="https://www.ft.com/content/ec433aea-64ec-40bc-b339-d372fe25c4ef?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">as long as the facilities are active</a>.” So who knows how long.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DELIVERY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/08/wing-reports-increase-deliveries-added-vendors?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Social Distancing Is the Wind Beneath Wing
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Wing drone" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81Mzkvd2luZ19kcm9uZS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Wing</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lady Gaga’s benefit concert may be grabbing headlines, but Alphabet subsidiary Wing doesn’t need Lizzo or Paul McCartney to help people during the pandemic. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What it does need: </strong>drones. Wing said yesterday its drone delivery service is adding vendors and new items as it experiences a <a href="https://www.cnet.com/news/alphabets-drone-service-delivers-medicine-during-coronavirus-pandemic/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">"dramatic" uptick</a> in customers. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Last April, Wing became the U.S.’ first drone operator to be FAA-certified as an air carrier, and in October it rolled out a test delivery program in the rural town of Christiansburg, VA. Deliveries have </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-08/alphabet-s-delivery-by-drone-surge-to-stay-at-home-customers?sref=1crrKBaO&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than doubled</a></span><span> in the area, Wing says. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The company partnered with FedEx and Walgreens, and now a local bakery, Mockingbird Cafe. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Social distancing has fueled massive demand for delivery...but the work exposes human workers to contracting COVID-19, among other health risks. This is a moment for coronavirus-immune alternatives like autonomous vehicles and drones to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/03/27/nuro-tusimple-continue-service-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">prove they can save the day</a>, Emerging Tech Brew writer Ryan Duffy reports.</p>

<img alt="Robot mannequin fans" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81Mjkvcm9ib3RfbWFubmVxdWluX2ZhbnMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With fans unable to attend the Chinese Professional Baseball League’s Opening Day on Saturday, the Rakuten Monkeys announced they’ll be putting <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/sports/mlb/2020/04/07/coronavirus-taiwanese-team-use-robots-fans-games-chinese-professional-baseball/2960662001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">robot mannequins</a> in the seats. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Since we are not allowed to have any fans in attendance, we might as well have some fun with it,” Monkeys general manager Justin Liu told the league’s website.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hey Marlins, just...think about it. That's all. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Every other Thursday, we're bringing you a few of the Brew's favorite business-related reads.</em></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">History: </strong></span><span><a href="http://www.americankingpin.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>American Kingpin</em></a></span><span> is Nick Bilton's unbelievable chronicle of how a young idealist who dubbed himself Dread Pirate Roberts built a billion-dollar dark web empire.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Memoir:</strong></span><span> </span><span><a href="https://www.penguinrandomhouse.ca/books/556683/the-ride-of-a-lifetime-by-robert-iger/9780399592096?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Ride of a Lifetime</em></a></span><span> chronicles Bob Iger's 15 years as Disney CEO. All we're saying is it takes something special at the top to run the world's most magical company.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Management: </strong></span><span><a href="https://www.eosworldwide.com/traction-book?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Traction</em></a></span><span> by Gino Wickman has been a guiding light for the Brew's leadership team. If you're looking for tools and strategies to lay out your business's goals and meet them, start here. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Have a suggestion for us? <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/O2tX0X?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Drop it here</a>. future.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/commodities/news/oil-price-gains-hope-opec-production-cut-coming-soon-coronavirus-2020-4-1029077498?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nHOUSING  \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nCoronavirus Turns Landlords Into Landserfs\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"NYC apartment illustration\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MzUvbnljX2FwYXJ0bWVudF9pbGx1c3RyYXRpb24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNearly one-third of U.S. apartment renters \u003ca href=\"https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/epg3xz/a-whole-lot-of-people-couldnt-pay-rent-this-month?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edid not pay\u003c/a\u003e any April rent in the first week of the month, according to the National Multifamily Housing Council and a group of real estate data providers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFor comparison’s sake...19% of tenants did not pay any rent in the first week of March and 18% didn’t in April 2019. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThis is not a case of mass “I left the check on the kitchen table.” The statistic highlights the severe pressure the coronavirus crisis has put on personal finances. Nearly 10 million Americans filed for unemployment in the last two weeks of March alone. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/nearly-a-third-of-u-s-renters-didnt-pay-april-rent-11586340000?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efew notes\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e about the data, to cover our bases: It does not count single-family homes and excludes public housing and subsidized affordable housing. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s...going to happen? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLocal and state governments across the country have enacted eviction moratoriums to keep people in their homes—for example, in March NY Gov. Andrew Cuomo suspended evictions for 90 days. But this economic crisis will last longer than those moratoriums, so some officials predict a “\u003ca href=\"https://ny.curbed.com/2020/4/7/21212353/new-york-coronavirus-rent-eviction-bill-covid-19?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etidal wave\u003c/a\u003e” of evictions in a few months unless they act.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere’s been \u003cem\u003esome \u003c/em\u003eaction:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe $2.2 trillion rescue package from the federal government expands unemployment coverage and gives most Americans a one-time direct payment. That aid should help, though it’s not directly tied to the housing market.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOne NYC landlord became a folk hero when he \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/landlord-waives-april-rent-200-tenants-amid-coronavirus-wants-everybody-n1176736?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewaived April rent\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for his 200 tenants. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut those stopgap measures aren’t enough on their own, especially because the real estate market has more moving parts than \u003cem\u003eWestworld\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs Bloomberg’s Brian Chappatta \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2020-03-25/coronavirus-a-rent-wipeout-could-ignite-a-mortgage-crisis?sref=1crrKBaO\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites\u003c/a\u003e, if tenants can’t afford to pay rent then property owners may default on mortgage payments. “That could bring the problem squarely onto the balance sheets of large U.S. banks.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" Out\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSen. Bernie Sanders \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/04/08/politics/bernie-sanders-drops-out/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edropped out\u003c/a\u003e of the Democratic presidential nomination race yesterday. Pour one out, but only the 99%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat leaves former VP Joe Biden as the presumptive nominee. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRoll the tape: \u003c/strong\u003eSanders, a self-described “democratic socialist,” pitched heavy taxes on the wealthy, the middle class, and corporations to fund large government programs like making public colleges and universities free, eliminating student and medical debt, and reorienting the economy to combat climate change. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn late February, it looked like Sanders could take this thing home. But he stumbled hard in big state primaries like Florida and Michigan. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e He may be 0 for 2 in presidential primaries in the last four years, but Sanders has \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/bernie-sanders-ends-bid-for-white-house-11586359593?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esucceeded in pulling\u003c/a\u003e the Democratic Party left. Once pie-in-the-sky, initiatives he championed like Medicare for All and the Green New Deal now have the support of many Democrats. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eSanders will still be on the ballot as state primaries continue, enabling him to rack up delegates so he can exert more influence at the party convention in August.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 1.38;\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003eYesterday, the Federal Reserve \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etemporarily lifted its cap\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003e on Wells a $1.95 trillion cap on Wells Fargo’s assets in 2018 as punishment for its fake account scandal. That meant Wells could only dole out \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.charlotteobserver.com/news/business/banking/article241846121.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$10 billion in loans\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003e to small businesses taking advantage of the government’s $349 billion Paycheck Protection Program (PPP).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 1.38;\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003eWells Fargo said it hit that $10 billion threshold in one weekend. As the U.S.’ \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/08/the-fed-is-lifting-wells-fargos-asset-cap-so-it-can-help-lend-to-small-business.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNo. 3 bank by assets\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003e, its participation in lending programs is as important as cold butter in your biscuit dough.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 1.38;\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003eSo the Fed loosened up.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: none;\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eNow, Wells can exceed that asset cap c/o loans made through either 1) PPP or 2) the forthcoming Main Street lending program, a Fed/Treasury collab. Any money Wells Fargo makes on the loans goes to the Treasury or a small business-focused nonprofit.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 1.38;\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe bank gets a break “\u003ca style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLady Gaga’s benefit concert may be grabbing headlines, but Alphabet subsidiary Wing doesn’t need Lizzo or Paul McCartney to help people during the pandemic. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat it does need: \u003c/strong\u003edrones. Wing said yesterday its drone delivery service is adding vendors and new items as it experiences a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnet.com/news/alphabets-drone-service-delivers-medicine-during-coronavirus-pandemic/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\"dramatic\" uptick\u003c/a\u003e in customers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLast April, Wing became the U.S.’ first drone operator to be FAA-certified as an air carrier, and in October it rolled out a test delivery program in the rural town of Christiansburg, VA. Deliveries have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-08/alphabet-s-delivery-by-drone-surge-to-stay-at-home-customers?sref=1crrKBaO\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than doubled\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in the area, Wing says. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe company partnered with FedEx and Walgreens, and now a local bakery, Mockingbird Cafe. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eSocial distancing has fueled massive demand for delivery...but the work exposes human workers to contracting COVID-19, among other health risks. This is a moment for coronavirus-immune alternatives like autonomous vehicles and drones to \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/03/27/nuro-tusimple-continue-service-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\"
